content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
• No new structures have been successfully built during these steps. The agent repeatedly attempted to establish a Laboratory at position (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs to advance research, but all placement and crafting attempts failed.  
• Although interactions occurred with furnace units—an iron-smelting furnace at (5.0, 5.0) and a copper-smelting furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)—these were existing infrastructure used for smelting operations and were not newly created.

ERROR TIPS
• API Call Consistency – When using get_entities, avoid mixing unsupported keyword arguments and positional parameters. Review the function’s signature so that only permitted arguments (and in the correct order) are supplied.  
• NoneType Handling – Ensure that entity-retrieval functions never return None before iterating over their results. Implement checks or fallback mechanisms to avoid errors such as “'NoneType' object is not iterable.”  
• Inventory Verification – Before attempting to place or supply a structure (e.g. the Laboratory), verify that the required item is actually present in the inventory to prevent placement errors.  
• Crafting Dependency Management – Track and satisfy all prerequisite ingredients for a complex item. Verify that sufficient raw resources and intermediate components (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables) are available prior to initiating Lab crafting to avoid cascading resource errors.
